title: Ticket #3399: Documentation missing for batch GAHP attributes
description:
Perusing the batch GAHP source code and some web examples, it appears there are some HTCondor ClassAd attributes that can be used to modify the resulting batch job. These do not appear to be documented in http://research.cs.wisc.edu/htcondor/manual/v7.9/5_3Grid_Universe.html#SECTION00635000000000000000 (but I cannot tell if it is a lack of documentation, poor examples, or things not enabled in the source code!).
  • Queue - the name of the queue.
  • HostSMPSize - the number of cores per node.
  • NodeNumber - the number of nodes requested.
remarks:
2013-Feb-19 15:44:15 by jfrey:
Blahp attribute Queue is settable in the Condor submit file as batch_queue, which is documented in the manual. The other two attributes are not exposed in the submit file interface. They're used by CREAM.

2014-Feb-25 11:18:22 by bbockelm:
Marian, Derek - can you check to see whether these are sufficiently explained in the OSG docs? If so, feel free to close the ticket.

2014-Sep-08 10:28:37 by blin:
Since this is documented in the HTCondor manual as well as the OSG HTCondor CE docs, this ticket can be closed.

2014-Sep-08 15:54:36 by blin:
I'm re-opening this ticket because I was made aware that the HostSMPSize and NodeNumber attributes are actually exposed in the submit file interface:

https://twiki.grid.iu.edu/bin/view/CampusGrids/BoscoMPI

2014-Sep-08 16:09:08 by dweitzel:
Matter of fact, they are actually used already in the HTCondor-CE, just not documented anywhere. See github source

If a job comes in with xcount set, it is appropriately translated to # of cores per job (single node). This is used in production by the OSG VO on the Nebraska resources.
